10 numbers to be sold two times. This happened during the month of greatest demand because the prize was the highest of the year. The project team is concerned that one of those tickets could be the winner.
What should the project manager do first?

choices.B: Stop the iteration as soon as possible in case an external change that makes the product invaluable is identified.
choices.D: Apply a pair programming technique to react to changes immediately, even in the middle of the interaction.
choices.A: Implement face-to-face communication between the team and product owner to change the iteration objectives as needed.
choices.C: Take action to reprioritize the backlog after every iteration to evaluate if user stories are still valuable to the business.

The project manager should **C. Take action to reprioritize the backlog after every iteration to evaluate if user stories are still valuable to the business**. In an agile project, the backlog is a living document that evolves as the project progresses and as the business environment changes. Regularly reprioritizing the backlog ensures that the team is always working on the most valuable features. This approach allows the project to adapt to changes in the business environment and ensures that the project continues to deliver value. However, the project manager should also consider the specific circumstances and dynamics of the project and the team when deciding on the best course of action. It's always important for the project manager to use their judgement and consider the unique aspects of the situation when deciding on the best course of action.

The company needs to reduce operating costs as much as possible and management insists that the project will now use a system running on a conventional dial-up service.
What should the project manager do next?
